comment.author: 47524421@N08
comment._content: The photo below, probably taken at San Diego, is either a cropped version of the one above, or the one above is a Photoshopped fabrication, adding NC90667 overhead. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6335560250/in/photostream] In any case: The aircraft overhead is Convair 240-2 c/n 71 NC90667, delivered to Pan Am on 10 June 1948. Pan Am sold it to Mid-Continent Airlines on 30 March 1950. Over the years it had was flown by various operators including Braniff Airways, Air Jordan as JY-ACA and Linee Aeree Italiane as I-LAKE. Unfortunately, it appears this Convair 240, carrying the Mexican registration XC-DOK, crashed into La Vega Hill near Poza Rica, Mexico on 25 January 1970. The aircraft carried journalists reporting on the Mexican presidential campaign, and 19 of 20 aboard were killed. Here it is in 1963 at Heathrow as N577R flying for F & L Corp. And again, at Templehof, Berlin, also in 1963. The aircraft in the foreground is American Airlines CV-240 c/n 60 "Flagship Cincinnati", N94232, previously named "Flagship Lake Arrowhead". An earlier AA DC-3 (N17339) was also named Flagship Cincinnati. The tail of the aircraft to the right belongs to Convair CV-240-1 c/n 17 NC8404H of Western Airlines. Here's a great photo of it in San Diego. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/sdasmarchives/6335558408/sizes/o/in/photostream/]
